title: 1973 Oil Embargo
desc: OAPEC proclaimed an oil embargo, raising the price of oil from $3 per barrel to almost $12.

title: 1979 Oil Crisis
desc: World oil output decreased in the wake of the Iranian Revolution. Widespread panic drove the price higher despite supply only falling by about 4%.

title: 1996 Grain Price Shock
desc: The US had an unusually cold winter in 1995-96 and wheat harvesting was not projected to be cost effective. However, wheat production only fell 6 percent. At the same time, US corn production was badly affected by drought.

title: Hurricane Katrina
desc: Katrina damaged much of the transport and export infrastructure in the Mississippi region. In 2004, just over half of US grain exports moved through the Mississippi River.

title: World food price crisis
desc: Between 2006 and 2008 average world prices for rice rose by 217%, wheat by 136%, corn by 125% and soybeans by 107%.
